name: Minerals & Treasure
intro: Zakat on minerals and buried treasure (rikaz) is due at the time of extraction. It is a special category with its own rules in Islamic law.

evidences.text: ...and whatever Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns...
For minerals, one-fifth (20%) is due as zakat at the time of extraction.

conditions: Owns minerals or buried treasure extracted from the earth.
calculation: For minerals: pay 2.5% of value. For rikaz (buried treasure): pay 20% at extraction.
example: Example: You extract gold worth $10,000. Pay 2.5% = $250. If rikaz, pay 20% = $2,000.
madhhabNotes: All schools: 2.5% on minerals, 20% on rikaz (buried treasure).

faq.a: Buried treasure from pre-Islamic times. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/129865/rikaz-buried-treasure-and-the-ruling-on-it

faq.q: Is zakat due on all minerals?
faq.a: Yes, if extracted and owned. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/129865/rikaz-buried-treasure-and-the-ruling-on-it
